speaker: Outstanding Art Direction for a Multi-Camera Series
text: Roy Christopher, Amy Skjonsby-Winslow, Ron Olsen  * * *  ## Transcript {Kelly Dean Hansen}

speaker: Skyline
text: The crescent moon rises over the city.  _ACT I  Scene One - KACL Frasier is standing by._
prevSpeaker: Outstanding Art Direction for a Multi-Camera Series

speaker: Frasier
text: We still have a few minutes left, and all our lines are open. Uh, shall I attempt another joke?

speaker: Roz
text: [_quietly_] No.

speaker: Roz
text: [_louder_] No!

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, then.  Come on, callers, don't be shy.  There's still time to talk with the good doctor.  Five open lines.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_beginning an act_] Who's this, then, Roz?  On line one, uh, whom do we have?  I understand we have... Susan, who recently moved here from... Texas. _He gestures to Roz to play along, and she shakes her head wearily, pleading no.  She does not want to do this._

speaker: Frasier
text: Go ahead, Susan, I'm listening.

speaker: Roz
text: [_giving in, putting on a Texas accent_] Hi, Dr. Crane.  [_N.B.  Peri Gilpin is originally from Waco, Texas._]

speaker: Roz
text: I'm new in town, from Texas, and uh, I just left my husband.

speaker: Frasier
text: I see, and why did you do that?

speaker: Roz
text: Well, uh... [_suddenly resuming her normal speech_] Oh, I know, he was abusive!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_glaring at her_] That couldn't have been easy for you.

speaker: Roz
text: [_resuming Texas accent_] Well, my girlfriend helped me. We just got in our convertible and drove through the desert, and we stopped at this honky-tonk.  I started dancing with this cowboy--long story short, he roughed me up, and my friend killed him--but then... we met the cutest cowboy, but he stole all our money, so we robbed a gas station and blew up a tanker truck...

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, I'm afraid we're out of time. I will finish with you off the air, _Susan_.  Meanwhile, this is Dr. Frasier Crane, saying Good Day, Seattle, and Good Mental Health.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, thank you, Thelma.  Or is it Louise?

speaker: Roz
text: Don't snap at me because you didn't get any phone calls today. I told you not to put me on the spot again.

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm sorry, Roz, but I was desperate.  You know, I really think you were closer with that character yesterday--the young teen who moved into the town that had banned dancing.  Now that, that had the tang of reality.

speaker: Roz
text: That was _Footloose_ , you idiot.  _FADE OUT  Scene Two - Frasier's apartment Martin opens the door to Ronee._

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, I thought you were working tonight.

speaker: Ronee
text: I got the night off, and I am kidnapping you for the weekend.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, where we going?

speaker: Ronee
text: My boss gave me his house in the mountains.  It's very romantic.  There's this little family of deer that comes right up to the window, so you might want to bring your...

speaker: Martin
text: My camera?  I will.

speaker: Ronee
text: I was going to say gun, but suit yourself.  Oh, you are going to love it.  There's this amazing view of the lake.  You can see every star in the sky.

speaker: Martin
text: Wow! Is there a VCR there? Because I just bought a couple of great old Ginger Rogers and Fred Astaire movies.

speaker: Ronee
text: Well, why didn't you just rent them?

speaker: Martin
text: I did, last August.

speaker: Ronee
text: Oh.  Let's get moving.  I don't want to get stuck in traffic.

speaker: Martin
text: Sounds good, I'll go pack some food.  That was really nice of your boss to give you the cabin.  What made him do it?

speaker: Ronee
text: I put out.

speaker: Martin
text: That's my girl!

speaker: Frasier
text: I hate people.

speaker: Martin
text: What's the matter with you?

speaker: Frasier
text: In a perfect ending to a perfect day, the driver next to me swerved to avoid hitting a squirrel, running me into a pothole and drenching me in coffee.  I hate squirrels, too.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, maybe it was for the best.  The coffee might have made you irritable.

speaker: Frasier
text: My show today was a fiasco.  For the second day in a row, we had virtually no callers.  It's getting harder and harder to blame it on Roz.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, maybe you fixed everybody.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh wait, there was one caller.  My date for Saturday night called to cancel because I am not her type.  Oh, and guess what?  Her honesty was not refreshing.

speaker: Frasier
text: Dear God, we're out of sherry.  Insult... [_placing the bottle down_] made injury.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, here's something that will cheer you up.  Ronee's boss gave her his cabin for the weekend, so we're heading up there tonight.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh.  Well, being home alone for the weekend might be just the thing for someone in my state of mind.  Me... and my shadow of a life. _Frasier's back is to Martin.  Eddie begs and paws at Martin, who addresses him._

speaker: Martin
text: [_to Eddie_] Hey!  We're not leaving you at home.  You're coming with us.  It wouldn't be any fun without you.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_turning around holding a glass_] Oh really, Dad?  I was so hoping that you would say that.  The last thing I wanted to do was spend the weekend here wallowing in self-pity.  Leave it to you to see right through me, and toss me a lifeline.

speaker: Martin
text: [_not sure how to react_] Well, uh, now are you sure, Fras? 'Cause, you know, uh, come to think of it, there are lots of squirrels up there.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I-I don't mind them in their own milieu.  Oh, gosh, I'm so looking forward to taking in some mountain air with the two of you, and isn't this fortuitous?  I've just had my Tyrolean hat re-feathered.

speaker: Ronee
text: [_to Martin_] Can I talk to you? _Martin nods sheepishly.  They go to the kitchen.  Frasier opens the door to Niles._

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, Frasier, I have had... the worst day imaginable.  I need a sherry.

speaker: Frasier
text: Brace yourself.

speaker: Niles
text: [_noticing the empty bottle_] You always think it's going to happen to someone else.

speaker: Frasier
text: I've opened some wine, Niles.  Help yourself.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, thanks.  Two of my patients cancelled, and Daphne and I spent the afternoon arguing over which diaper pail we would buy for the nursery.  Then, driving home, I successfully avoided hitting a squirrel, only to be nearly run off the road by some horn-happy maniac.

speaker: Frasier
text: That was me, you simp, you nearly killed me.

speaker: Niles
text: You nearly killed me!  And what was that crude multi-part gesture you unleashed on me?

speaker: Frasier
text: I had hot coffee all over my hand.

speaker: Frasier
text: You know what, I do not wish to delve into this.  I am trying to put my own miserable day behind me.  To that end, Ronee and Dad are going to the mountains this weekend, and I've decided to tag along.

speaker: Niles
text: Ah.  So it'll be just two wheels and you.

speaker: Frasier
text: What are you saying?

speaker: Niles
text: Well, just that if Ronee and Dad are going away for the weekend, it might have been more considerate not to horn in.

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm not horning in, they invited me.

speaker: Niles
text: Ah.  I would never dream of accepting such an obvious pity invite.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, you don't have to dream because they didn't invite you.

speaker: Martin
text: It happened so fast, then he got all excited and I didn't know what to say.

speaker: Ronee
text: Well, how about "I was talking to the dog?"

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, you know, the poor guy's going through a bad patch right now.  He could use a little company.  We don't have to spend any time with him.

speaker: Ronee
text: Marty, you know I love Frasier, but this was supposed to be our weekend, you know, you and me alone.

speaker: Martin
text: I know.

speaker: Ronee
text: But hey, why stop at Frasier?  Why not invite Niles and Daphne and make it a party?

speaker: Niles
text: We'd love to!  Thank you, Ronee!  Thanks, Dad! [_exiting, with a taunting tone_] Frasier... _Ronee sighs and turns to Martin.  FADE TO:_ **MY BROTHER'S REAPER** _Scene Three - The kitchen of a mountain cabin. Daphne is at the counter.  Martin and Ronee are preparing to go out. Frasier enters._

speaker: Frasier
text: Morning.

speaker: Daphne
text: You're finally up.  How'd you sleep?

speaker: Frasier
text: Perfectly.  I was borne off to dreamland by the cooing of a morning dove.

speaker: Ronee
text: Oh, I heard that too.  I think the weasels are in heat.

speaker: Martin
text: Ronee and I are taking a walk down to the lake.  Anybody interested?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, no thanks, Pa.  I'm fixin' to have me some vittles.

speaker: Ronee
text: Is he going to talk hillbilly all weekend?

speaker: Martin
text: Ah, you should have heard him the weekend of the Renaissance Faire.

speaker: Frasier
text: See you guys later.

speaker: Martin
text: All right.

speaker: Ronee
text: Okay, bye. _Martin and Ronee exit, leaving Frasier and Daphne alone.  From this point on, it is clear that the scene is a dream sequence.  Note that Daphne is wearing a lounge outfit, and is very pregnant._

speaker: Frasier
text: Ah, Daph.  You know who would have really enjoyed this trip? [_wistfully_] Niles.

speaker: Daphne
text: You're right.  But let's not dwell on that.  We'll make our own fun.

speaker: Frasier
text: Right.  Something smells good.  Whatcha cookin'?

speaker: Daphne
text: Sausage patties.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh.  Hope they're hot and spicy.  That's the way I like it.

speaker: Daphne
text: I know you do.

speaker: Daphne
text: You're so different from your brother.

speaker: Frasier
text: Really?  How so?

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, for one thing... you're alive.

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, I can't believe there are still people who blame me for Niles's death.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, people will talk about anything.  So you sliced him to ribbons with your wheat thresher.  It was your first time farming, for God's sakes.

speaker: Daphne
text: What did I do with the salt?  Hmmm... _She turns the largest canister.  Next to matching ones labeled "Flour, Sugar," etc., it clearly reads "Niles."_

speaker: Daphne
text: Maybe I left it in the dining room. _She moves across the room to another cupboard and turns the smallest of another set of canisters.  It is labeled "Eddie."  She exits the kitchen._

speaker: Daphne
text: [_calling from behind the door_] Oh, I forgot to mention...

speaker: Frasier
text: What's that, dear? _A very non-pregnant Daphne now enters in a sexy red nightie, holding a swaddled bundle._

speaker: Daphne
text: I just had your baby.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_rising_] I have never seen anything more beautiful in my entire life. _He tenderly takes the "baby" from Daphne, unceremoniously throws it on the counter, and takes her in a passionate kiss and embrace.  SMASH CUT TO: a horrified Frasier waking up from his dream.  He gasps and contorts his face in puzzlement over the frightening dream.  CUT TO:  Scene Four - The same kitchen Cut from the preceding.  The following scene is clearly back in "reality."  It is late at night, and Niles is seated at the table reading.  Frasier enters._

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier?  I thought you went to bed.

speaker: Frasier
text: I-I had a rather bizarre dream.

speaker: Niles
text: Really?  What about?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh...

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I'm not sure you'd really want to hear about this one, Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, clearly it troubled you.  It might help you to discuss it.  You know how I enjoy interpreting dreams.

speaker: Frasier
text: Mmm... Well, all right, uh... [_clears throat_] it took place in this very kitchen, and... I was married to Daphne and we were expecting a baby, and, uh... you were dead, and I killed you.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, I can see how that might disturb you.

speaker: Frasier
text: Indeed. [_He sips his coffee._]

speaker: Niles
text: A man of your intellect having such an obvious dream.

speaker: Frasier
text: I beg your pardon?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, come on.  You're lonely, and you envy what I have.  I was just hoping for something more complex, you know, a stairway leading nowhere or Mom giving you a physical.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, there were many other perplexing details that I left out.  For instance, uh, well there was um... a wheat thresher and... some sausage patties.  And Eddie was dead, too.

speaker: Niles
text: Ah, well, there's a real head-scratcher.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, thank you for your exhaustive analysis, Dr. Crane. Perhaps you should relocate your offices to a drive-thru so your patients could speak into a clown's nose.

speaker: Niles
text: All right, I'm going to bed now.  I was hoping this book would make me drowsy, but it looks like your dream has done the trick instead.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_calling out to him petulantly_] You died tragically, and no one missed you!  _Frasier sips his coffee.  FADE TO:  Scene Five - KACL Frasier enters Roz's booth._

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, hi, Roz.

speaker: Roz
text: Finally, your show's about to start.

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm sorry.  We just got back from the mountains this morning.

speaker: Roz
text: Well, you're about to get all the vacation you can handle. Kenny says if you don't get a call today, you're off the air.

speaker: Frasier
text: What?!  Well, we're bound to get a call.

speaker: Roz
text: Why?  We haven't had a call in six months. _It is revealed that Roz's control panel is covered in cobwebs, indicating that this is another dream._

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, dear.

speaker: Roz
text: You're on!

speaker: Frasier
text: What?

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello, Seattle, this is Dr. Frasier Crane.  Who's our first caller, Roz?

speaker: Roz
text: We have no one from nowhere.

speaker: Frasier
text: Very amusing, Roz.

speaker: Frasier
text: What's that sound?

speaker: Roz
text: It's a phone!  Go get it!  Hurry!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh! _He rushes out of the booth.  The studio desk is covered with phones, red and black.  Frasier picks up a red one._

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello!  Hello, Seattle, I'm listening!

speaker: Roz
text: Not that one, the black one!

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello!  Seattle, I'm listening. [_It's not the right one._]

speaker: Roz
text: [_pointing_] Right there!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_trying again_] Hello!  Hello, Seattle...

speaker: Roz
text: Hurry!  They're going to hang up. _The multiple rings continue, raising to a pitch.  Frasier keeps trying different phones._

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello... Hello... Hello... headscarf and sunglasses.  She is behind a steering wheel mounted on the control panel._

speaker: Roz
text: [_Texas accent_] If you don't find that phone, I'm driving this booth off a cliff.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_desperately trying to find the right one_] Hello.... Hello.... Oh, God, I'm trying to listen... [_He sobs._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh!  Damn it! _FADE OUT  END OF ACT I  ACT II_  **SWEENEY TOT** _Scene Six - A surreal-looking nursery, with very bright colors and loud decor.  Throughout the scene, Daphne's voice is heard as through a loudspeaker/PA system.  We do not see her in the course of the dream. Niles is sitting in a bright red chair near a bright green table, trying to take care of a baby._

speaker: Daphne
text: [_v.o., fade in_] Niles, how's the baby?  Have you fed the baby yet?

speaker: Daphne
text: Make sure you warm the bottle first, but not too hot.  Should I come up? _The bottle has become an ignited stick of dynamite in Niles's hand. He quickly tosses it back, and we hear an explosion.  Niles jerks the baby up and back._

speaker: Daphne
text: What was that?  Is everything all right up there?  I'm coming to check.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_over Niles's actions_] Don't forget to burp him.  If you don't burp him, he'll cry.  I'd better do it myself.  Here I come. Is the baby okay?  What's going on?  I'm on my way. _Niles leans on a florescent green crib.  A buzzing sound is heard. We see that Niles has set the baby on a conveyor belt and the bundle is heading toward a saw-blade, head first.  He quickly saves and cuddles it._

speaker: Daphne
text: He's going to need a new nappy, too.  But don't forget your other responsibilities, Niles.  There's lots of other responsibilities. _Niles sets the baby down again.  He goes to an oven and puts the finishing pinches on an unusually large pie, which he places in the oven over Daphne's following speech._

speaker: Daphne
text: You have to prioritize, and the baby comes first.  Is he all right?  I'm coming up there. _He closes the oven door and goes back to the crib.  He pulls something out of the crib, but it is a bag of apples._

speaker: Daphne
text: Make sure you support his head when you hold him.  Are you doing it right?  I'm coming to check.  Are you ignoring me? Why don't I hear anything?  Do I have to do everything around here? _Realizing, Niles rushes to the oven.  After the smoke clears, he removes the pie, digs into it, and pulls out the baby._

speaker: Daphne
text: Do I smell something burning?

speaker: Daphne
text: I'm on my way. _Niles sees that the bottle warmer is smoking and begins to run to it. As he does, he trips, and the baby flies into the air.  When it lands, we see porcelain shatter across the floor._

speaker: Daphne
text: What was that?  I'd better not find a mess.  I have enough work taking care of the baby.  I can't clean up after you, too. _Niles frantically begins picking up the pieces of the "baby."  He sees the doorknob with child guard begin to turn.  The camera focuses on his face, a picture of sheer horror._

speaker: Daphne
text: Is everything all right in there? _SMASH CUT TO: The scene cuts back to the cabin.  Niles, in bed next to Daphne, awakens from his nightmare._

speaker: Niles
text: [_sitting up, gasping_] I can't do it.

speaker: Daphne
text: It's just as well, I'm too tired anyway.  _FADE TO:  Scene Seven - The cabin kitchen Frasier is seated, playing a chess set (the one he won from Wayne Shafter in[[11.12]](/frasier/transcripts/season_11/episode_12/frasier_lite.html "Frasier-Lite") "Frasier-Lite"?)  Daphne enters from the door she did when presenting Frasier with his child in his dream.  She is dressed in the same lounge outfit as in that dream.  She looks pregnant. _

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, you couldn't sleep either?

speaker: Daphne
text: Just thought I'd fix meself a little snack.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, you're entitled, eating for two.

speaker: Daphne
text: I had the baby five months ago.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh.  Yes, that's right, I had Roz send you some flowers. _Daphne now looks slightly larger than before as she turns around. Clearly, this is Daphne's dream._

speaker: Daphne
text: I just have a few extra pregnancy pounds I haven't been able to lose yet.  I work out every day.  It's really starting to show. _She is now noticeably larger in the lower half of her body.  She lifts dumbbells with both arms._

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh yes.  Well done.  I'll have Roz send you some flowers. _Niles enters from outside in his bathrobe, accompanied by a busty blonde in a blue bikini.  She is wearing a toolbelt and carrying a plunger._

speaker: Niles
text: Excuse us.  The plumber has to fix the leaky faucet in our bedroom.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, sure.  Go right on up. _Niles leads the "plumber" by the hand through the now familiar door out of the kitchen._

speaker: Daphne
text: Isn't he a clever one, finding a plumber at this hour?  Isn't he a clever one, finding a plumber at this hour. _Daphne has expanded again.  She is unnaturally large, exceeding even her peak in the first part of Season Eight (a subtle reminder of that storyline?)_

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, indeed.  How fat of you to notice. _A knock at the front door.  Daphne answers to a gorgeous brunette in a tan bikini.  She also wears a toolbelt._

speaker: Daphne
text: Hello.

speaker: Woman
text: I'm here about the cable problem?

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, I don't know anything about that.

speaker: Niles
text: [_rushing back in_] I'll handle this, Darling. [_suggestively_] Cable's out in the bedroom.

speaker: Woman
text: [_sultry tone_] Well, let's see what you've got going on in there.

speaker: Daphne
text: Bless him.  He's on top of everything around here.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_contemplating his chess set_] You know, I really miss playing with Niles.  He's so busy sleeping with other women.

speaker: Daphne
text: What did you say?

speaker: Niles
text: [_re-entering_] Have you seen Dad? _Daphne has expanded yet again.  She is truly huge, and her face now also shows it._

speaker: Daphne
text: Do you still think I'm beautiful? _Another busty blonde enters from another door.  She wears a flannel bikini top and tight khaki shorts, and carries Martin's cane._

speaker: Niles
text: Dad!  There you are.  I need to show you something in the bedroom. _He takes her hand and leads her back where he took the other two. Daphne runs after him in her hot-air-balloon-like state._

speaker: Daphne
text: Niles, wait! _She tries to go through the door after them, but she cannot fit through and bounces back.  She calls after Niles._

speaker: Daphne
text: Please tell me you think I'm beautiful!  Niles, answer me! _Her face is now so fat that it distorts her speech.  She begins to sob.  SMASH CUT TO: Suddenly she awakens next to Niles._

speaker: Daphne
text: Niles!

speaker: Niles
text: Are you all right?

speaker: Daphne
text: How could you?!

speaker: Niles
text: I'm sorry?

speaker: Daphne
text: You'd better be! _Niles cowers.  Daphne turns around and goes back to sleep.  FADE TO:_ **IT'S ENOUGH TO WAKE THE DAD**  _Scene Eight - The cabin kitchen Back in reality.  Daphne enters from the familiar door, in the same lounge outfit.  Frasier is playing chess._

speaker: Daphne
text: [_grumpily_] Hello.

speaker: Frasier
text: Hi, Daph.

speaker: Daphne
text: What are you doing here?

speaker: Frasier
text: Had a nightmare.  Couldn't get back to sleep.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_sitting_] That's strange.  Niles had a nightmare, too. And I just dreamt...

speaker: Frasier
text: [_interrupting_] Niles had a nightmare?

speaker: Daphne
text: Mm-hmm.

speaker: Frasier
text: What about?

speaker: Daphne
text: He dropped the baby and it shattered.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_chuckling_] That's perfect.  Wait a minute.  How did he drop it?  Was it from a height?  In a crowd?  Was there water involved?

speaker: Daphne
text: No, it was in the nursery.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_satisfied_] Yes!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, hi, Niles!  I understand you had a bad dream. [_He chuckles._]

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, it was utterly inscrutable.  There was a table saw and apple pies, and...

speaker: Frasier
text: Spare me, Niles, you broke the baby.  Now who has the obvious dreams?

speaker: Niles
text: It was still more interesting than yours. [_to Daphne_] Frasier dreamed he killed me and married you.

speaker: Daphne
text: At least he wasn't cheating on me with the service people because I was fat!

speaker: Niles
text: Will you please stop blaming me for something I did in your dreams?

speaker: Daphne
text: So you admit it?

speaker: Niles
text: Daphne, Daphne, I will always find you attractive.  Your dream shouldn't worry you at all, unlike mine.  I could very well turn out to be a bad father.

speaker: Frasier
text: At least you two can face your fears together.  Whom do I have to hug away my nighttime terrors, hmm?

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, boo-hoo, send yourself some flowers.

speaker: Frasier
text: I beg your pardon?  That's a rather flippant comeback, when I express myself...

speaker: Niles
text: [_talking over him_] Don't you take that tone with my wife!

speaker: Daphne
text: He finally notices I'm in the room. _They all begin to argue over each other.  Martin enters in his bathrobe._

speaker: Martin
text: What the hell is going on here?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, Dad, it's this infernal mountain air.  It's giving us all nightmares.

speaker: Martin
text: All of you?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, Daphne dreamed that she was terminally fat, Niles that he was going to be a bad parent, and... well, at least mine arose from a real problem, the fact that I will always be alone.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, geez, we come up here to relax, and you're arguing about your dreams?

speaker: Niles
text: Well, dreams that reveal genuine anxieties, which...

speaker: Martin
text: Blah, blah, blah. [_to Daphne_] You're going to lose your looks? Happens to everyone. [_to Frasier_] You're afraid you're going to end up alone?  You'll still have your family. [_to Niles_] You're afraid you're going to be a bad father?  Join the club. Now just clam it up and go to bed.

speaker: Niles
text: You know, I'm starting to regret inviting him up here.  _FADE TO:  Scene Nine - The cabin living room Martin is getting a drink.  The other three enter from the kitchen. It should be noted that unlike the previous scene, Martin's dressing gown is cinched up to well above his collar, obscuring his neck._

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, we're sorry.

speaker: Niles
text: You were right.

speaker: Daphne
text: Maybe we let our problems get to us a bit too much.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, hell yes, if they're the worst of your problems, you're lucky.  I've got a bullet in my hip, a girlfriend who's too good for me and might realize it any day, a dog who's pushing eighty in human years, and I'm not far behind him.  But you don't hear me making a fuss, do you?  Know why?  'Cause I focus on what's good about my life.  You know what you people should do?  Let's tell them, Ronee. _Suddenly, Ronee appears behind a piano, wearing a robe.  We have now entered Martin's dream.  As she begins to play, he begins to sing, shedding his robe and tossing it to Frasier, Niles, and Daphne.  Underneath he is now wearing a tuxedo with tails.  As he starts his song, he tosses his cane like Astaire would toss his umbrella, and then catches a snappy walking stick that is tossed back to him.  It becomes a full-fledged dance number._

speaker: Martin
text: [_singing_] _Grab your coat and get your hat Leave your worries on the doorstep Life can be so sweet On the sunny side of the street_ _The scene darkens, and the piano accompaniment fades into a full orchestration for the transition to the next verse.  Feathers pass in front of Martin's face, and they are revealed to be the hats of a group of Rockette-like dancers who accompany the rest of the number.  Martin and the dancers step upon a Vegas-like stage with full lighting as the second verse begins._

speaker: Martin
text: [_singing_] _Can't you hear that pitter-pat? And that happy tune is your step Life can be complete On the sunny side of the street_ _Ronee now joins him onstage wearing a ball gown.  She dances with him and they sing the rest of the song together._

speaker: Martin/Ronee
text: _I used to walk in the shade With my blues on parade But I'm not afraid And this rover, crossed over_

speaker: Martin/Ronee
text: _If I never have a cent I'll be rich as Rockefeller Gold dust at my feet On the sunny side of the street!_ _The number ends.  Martin and Ronee bow and wave.  DISSOLVE TO: the scene fades to the two of them cuddling in bed together, completely content.  In his sleep, he pulls her closer, she gives a "mmm" and snuggles up to him._ [_N.B. "On the Sunny Side of the Street" is a jazz standard by Fields/McHugh._] _FADE OUT.  END OF ACT II_
